title: [FEATURE] Allow SKColorF on SKPaint
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

In the `dev/update-skia`, `SKPaint` only has a `Color` property, of type `SKColor` (8-bit per channel)

In the [C++ Skia](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/skia/include/core/SkPaint.h;l=270?q=SKPaint&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc:third_party%2Fskia%2F&originalUrl=https:%2F%2Fcs.chromium.org%2F), one can also use floating point colors `ColorF`. Furthermore in the C++ API one can tell the paint what the colorspace of the color is... 

When using Skia's [linear rendering workflow](https://skia.org/user/sample/color?cl=9919), it is important to allow all colors to be specified in higher precision, with a linear transfer function
 
**Describe the solution you'd like**

Somehow expose this linear rendering stuff, still keeping C#'s handy property syntax?

Maybe create a `PhysicalColor` struct that holds both a `SKColorF` and `SKColorSpace`, and add properties like `SKPaint.PhysicalColor`?

**Additional context**

I guess in general supporting all the  [linear rendering workflow](https://skia.org/user/sample/color?cl=9919) features in Skia will be a lot of work?
